yvOH8qyRJrhvIJmrd4gOKg.text: This place is RIDICULOUSLY OVERPRICED! Entrees do not come w salads, and the pasta is good but not $360 for 5 people good!?! One mixed drink and 2 draft beers was $38-- outside of dinner. Save your money.

XOQDcGr0-kSx80IKN4K72w.text: Well, prior to the opening of this restaurant on Hart's Run I had never been to a Il Pizzaiolo. After my experience at this place I was not sure I would EVER go back. Expensive-mediocre food and wait staff. As it turns out a friend in Wexford asked if we could meet at the Il Pizzaiolo in Warrendale-Yikes!!!!I was ready for a similar experience but I was WRONG!!!!! The wait staff very friendly and attentive - the salad crisp - and rather than expounding on how pizza could be cooked in 90 seconds (but be delivered to the table just barely warm).....a hot, crispy, lightly browned delicious pizza was delivered to the table!!!!! Somehow all of these things made the expense easier to SWALLOW!!!!!

snUsITrd3bANpNQvrOyDBQ.text: Great pizza in an area that really doesn't have good pizza. And a nice looking restaurant too!

7DdZhjQfMZoU_7JZyukhxQ.text: What a joke!  This place is so over priced for poor quality food.  Cut the prices in half and it would still be bad.  $38 dollars for a 6 cut pizza with very little pepperoni, 4 meat balls, and a small salad.  Don't waste your time eating here.

Nv8Y0d9anQ3kDm0o5kG3Qg.text: The Asian with the prison tats is the worst bartender ever.  Forgot my order when we were the only bar order.

xbL1dK7xIXlbK1VsheA-ew.text: This restaurant is a perfect example of a train rolling out of control. I've been going to Il Pizzaiolo for many years in Mt. Lebanon & have always enjoyed the appetizers & my meal. Over the years, the appetizers have become smaller and the prices larger. The quality has also diminished. That being said, this new location is a perfect location for an area lacking in dining choices. The food is still of fairly good quality. The prices are simply out of control. Period. When you think about the price of home made pasta that you can purchase at most Italian grocerias vs the price they are asking here, you will seriously consider making your own meal. The staff is mostly knowledgeable and friendly enough to earn their tip. My advice is to try it out, but try others as well. You will find that you will get a comparable meal for much less elsewhere. Opening new locations and sacrificing product as well as raising prices and putting out smaller portions is the way restaurants put a bad taste in consumers mouthes.

aarqD6iBxGLh3X9tfAUXww.text: Already been here twice, after having passed the building site on the way to the gym (!) for quite some time. Welcome to the neighborhood excellent pizza, we've been waiting for you! Just as delicious as the other branches. Pretty happy camper! And delighted to see that they have very nice happy hour options. The bar area is great. The dining room is nicer than Warrendale I think. But I would always consider a trip out to Mount Lebanon for their awesome patio and wine bar. It doesn't look like the patio will be terrific here which is a shame. But for quality food this is your place.

BUDzF1IfYBHHyW9xKtQokQ.text: We ordered from this place late on a Tuesday and got quick, delicious take-out, which in this part of town has been virtually impossible on weeknights after 7pm. Strongly recommend the rice balls (Arancini!); you get four large tasty rice things, two kinds. We got a pizza (yums, much higher quality ingredients and combos than neighboring pizza places, but the zas are smaller). Also definitely get the lemon cake thing (Delizia al limone) - it's a very impressive looking dessert, with a light delicate cream layer inside and soft sweet icing on something that's kinda like lemon pound cake, serving 1-2. We'll count this as a standby for late-night dinner orders out.

raFNLUTJ5v9YPM-rr12TLA.text: Stopped by this new Italian place for pizza take-out.  Thought I'd give it a try.  Ordered 2 pizzas (only one size available - 10 inch).  Each had 2 toppings.  Total bill was $41.73!!!  Yes,  you read that right.  Not talking about Manhattan here.  This is Glenshaw!!!  Pizza was ok, but I've had better from Calliente's and Barrel Junction.  Staff was friendly and the place seemed to have a nice ambiance.  But, really.  Prices are way out of line on all levels.  Won't be back.

xhLPEqQ5pwM4pab6Fv-O6w.text: Good food (not great,-- but definitely not bad) We ordered stuffed clams-- they were good, but truly the smallest clams I have ever seen (smaller than the size of a quarter) ! -- service was friendly, the place was clean and modern looking..very nice I thought - but the cost---- wow-- prices are WAY too high for what the food is -- which is the only reason I would not return -- They said they opened in May-- it still seems"new" ---again tho no real complaints- except the price vs the food -- I didn't think I got what I paid for

iR2fQe-dAGoji2Lh0epY5g.text: This place is pretty overpriced for what you get. Our server was nice but otherwise this place is not worth the money or time in my opinion. The drinks were blah, the pizza was decent but totally overpriced, the pasta was pretty generic for the high price. With the good food scene in Pittsburgh this place was pretty disappointing. I won't return.

vyLXtWm_M7sR3mLc8FL-Kw.text: I wanted to hate this place, given the reviews.  But I can't.  First off, its expensive.  This isn't value-priced Italian food.  But the thing is, the food there is pretty darn good.  I walked out feeling content, and not feeling like I just got fleeced.  The wedding soup was good, has orzo rice in it.  Really enjoyed the arancini (fried rice balls).  Comes with 2 of each, one stuffed with cheese, the other with veggies on a bed of red sauce.  Got a free appetizer of marinated veggies.  These were all great, was a nice little app.  The calzone was really good.  Dough tastes fresh, homemade.  Stuffed to the gills with meats and veggies.  Was impressed by how fresh it tasted.  The osso buco was also very good.  Tender, fall apart meat with a side of cheesy risotto.  Finished with a piece of tiramisu that was so big two of us couldn't finish it, and we took half of it home.  Bottom line, you know going in that you aren't paying value prices for an Italian meal.  But the food tastes upscale, and the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. This won't be my go-to Italian place, but I'd take family here on special occasions.

rfyCoDaLcs9zmpEamqxbqw.text: Very disappointed in our experience. It was very apparent that our waitress did not want to be working that night. She was not very friendly and it seemed as if we were a burden to her. Our food arrived 45 minutes after we ordered. We were seated near the "wood fire" station and observed the 2 workers on their phones the majority of the time and then never washed their hands when assembling the pizzas (they were not wearing any gloves). I was surprised to see managers walking by and not commenting on their actions.

YjK8gOx2UJ7OPPugc7SeTQ.text: Food was just ok.  Terribly overpriced for the quality from the wine to the appetizers to the entrees. Best dish was the arancine.  My dinner  RIGATONI DISGRAZIATA    Eggplant, San Marzano Tomatoes, Basil, Toasted  Bread Crumbs, Ricotta Salata was disappointing- bland a few cubes of steamed eggplant 1 basil leaf no bread crumbs and very little SHAVED ? Ricotta   They offered to make gnocchi in 2 mins. I passed on the gnocchi ( by the time the manager came over everyone else was finished with their mediocre meals. They removed my meal from the bill.  The atmosphere was very nice and the waitress was pleasant, however, this is definitely not worth a second chance.

kbLaj2hmaZgOap4nzKR8Yw.text: This is a beautiful, comfortable setting with a large patio. Decor is roman forum.Food quality varies wildly....oddly, the pizza is just drek. Super thin and soggy, it is both under cooked in the middle, and charred at the edges. If you cant learn to control the heat in a fire oven, i guess you should just cook it in a regular pizza oven. Pizza was a disaster. The fish special however was great according to the SO and the pasta dish was good. service is trying to be deliberately paced and chic unrushed, but sometimes thats a cover for inattentive service.

46pOtDBUFoNwka_lOG4ACA.text: Screams faux!  Romanesque interior, metal barn exterior.  Upscale prices, downscale food quality.  Far better Italian meals available elsewhere.  Way overpriced for what you get.

uXyv7nbnLoxKp72ixmv-Zw.text: OMG! The DOC pizza is totally out of this world. Loving the mistasomething salad and the house Pinot Grigio as well. So happy this place is close and convenient. Friendly bartender and great server. Definitely coming back.

lHmCTyFYH6a5pJo73YZqXQ.text: Pricy for mediocre food and HORRIBLE service.  Been there for dinner and happy hour. Would not recommend...

GSdxO6k7tJoXRozvVc3oDQ.text: Flat-out incredible.  The food is off-the-charts, and the staff is super friendly (particularly Gianna, and the manager spends time talking to just about every patron...really cool s#it).  The Ragu might be better than my gram's (don't tell) and the wine selection is incredible.  If you live within 20 miles of this place and haven't been, you're missing the best the North has offer.

YThgUzyBk27-E9vA869jbg.text: An unexpected gem in Glenshaw!  True Italian menu with many homemade items. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, the wine list was quite good. We enjoyed our meals and the lovely ambience of the decor. Some may consider it to be a bit expensive, but the food, the wine, the service and the atmosphere are all quite worth it. Can't wait to go back!

imIOdYfXXyvwRcMfWIToag.text: Seriously the best pizza crust I've had in years!  If you're looking for traditional pittsburgh-style pizza this is not the place for you and you'll not appreciate the prices.  If you're looking for perfect Neapolitan-style pizza in a stylish Italian restaurant and are willing to pay for artisanal quality, then you'll love this place.  We had the Margherita DOC and Quattro Formaggi and both were delicious.  The bar was a little slow but the Liberta was worth the wait.

MZp7F6KXeCfyFQIacATOLg.text: Have been a few times and will probably not go much in the future. For what you get they are too expensive. 20$ for a pizza that at most serves two people? Pastas overpriced as well. They say they are more expensive because they use the best ingredients. Unfortunately I'm not sure they will be able to sustain this location with the current prices

uK2k6Sy9mDxQW-QfEPWE8Q.text: Nice place, great atmosphere, a little pricey for what they offer, but overall good experience, great service, very clean

YGyKE_t-jRmbXb9UvveVrQ.text: Jason and staff @il Pizzaiolo in Hampton were beyond accommodating for a recent birthday celebration. The food was exceptional! High quality imported ingredients from Italy and made daily dough. The service was top notch! They took the time to explain everything and answer any questions our 24 person party had. The location is beautifully themed and designed. I highly recommend this gem for both large and small parties. We will be returning many times for sure.

g3w7GIk8Ka9t0Qek7u5g3A.text: This was the worse Italian restaurant I've ever eaten in Food was awful and so overpriced I couldn't believe it. A salad didn't even come with the $19 spaghetti and, we got 1 1/2 pieces of tasteless bread with tasteless olive oil  Waitress gave us a story about cheese being flown in from Italy every Thursday which sounds Far fetched to me she said pasta was made there Didn't taste fresh to me I think they're trying to impress people or, trying to justify the price Waitress was polite in the beginning, not so much after I told her I didn't really like my dinner I will not eat here again, I'll be surprised if they make it 1 year!

uQMMrytcHj6nIQAse-7DDQ.text: Amazing service. I placed a take out order this evening, but when I arrived home an ingredient was missing from the pizza. It ended up being a miscommunication with the staff that took my order over the phone. The manager actually got on the phone and without even hearing the situation said "I will bring you the correct pizza right now." He got in his car and 15 minutes later delivered the pizza himself. This is above and beyond anything I have ever experienced in the restaurant industry. It says a lot of the care he and his staff show to their customers. Made a customer for life this evening.

KoQSktM0V79Btv0aoKMqBw.text: You get only one chance at a first impression.  I have never been greeted so rudely by a restaurant hostess.  This is a new location and they were busy but to be told that me and my family should leave because they were too busy is shocking.  I live about 1 mile away and I will not return and I will not suggest any of my neighbors go to this location.  A shame that this is how they behave this early in their life.  A short life no doubt.

zthbS-5dT_nAaXkB8QviLA.text: We were so excited to see this place going in so close to home, but it was such a disappointment!  We really thought (hoped) this would be a semi-upscale pizza place with family-friendly, modestly priced Italian offerings, but it's the opposite of that.  The menu is strange and very over priced, we would never attempt to take our kids here (not like we'll be back anyways)!    Short version:   I wish there was a zero-star option, I get nervous just driving by this place now. Don't ever go here.    Long version:  Upon being seated by the less-than-friendly three-person hosting team, who seemed more eager to flirt with one another than perform their duties, we were impressed by the decor and atmosphere, our hopes were high.  Unfortunately they were dimmed quickly when our waitress appeared and it became clear that this was going to be a strange meal. Her demeanor was almost off-putting and it seemed as though she had not only never waited a table in her life, but also had never been to a restaurant before, let alone a high-end place like this.  It was kind of creepy to be honest.   My wife requested iced tea, something every restaurant in this area offers from McDonalds to Morton's. Our waitress who appeared to have never interacted with another human before, strangely asked my wife to clarify what type of tea she'd like, suggesting three italian-named options that we didn't understand, you know, cause we don't speak italian.  My wife repeated the request for simple unsweetened iced tea.  The "waitress" was baffled and again repeated the three foreign-sounding options from which my wife randomly chose one, for no other reason than to end the bizarre conversation.  I ordered ice water.  Eight minutes later our server returned with a bottle of italian fruit-flavored tea in a glass bottle (like you'd get in a convenience store) and a small cup, and a carafe of warm tap water and small cup for me.  No ice.  My wife had to open her $8 italian convenience store tea and pour it into a scotch glass and I had to serve myself the water.  Not a big deal, I'm not a snob, but for these prices, this was not expected at all. Better service can readily be found at Applebees.  The iced tea was disgusting. My wife can be picky with such things but I am not, so i gave it a try.  Nothing short of gross.    The service was extremely bizarre throughout our entire meal.  At times our waitress would return to the table and not say a word, just stand there staring blankly.  After three such visits and my politely telling her we need a bit more time, I told her that my wife is lactose intolerant and that we were having trouble finding anything on the menu that should could eat. This was greeted with silence.  Not an "I'm so sorry" or an entree suggestion or two, nothing. It may have been the most awkward situation I've ever encountered in a restaurant.  After about 30 seconds of silence (which felt like an hour), my wife, in frustration, just ordered the spaghetti (for $19) and I ordered some sort of cheese and sausage-filled pasta dish for I believe around $28.  Half of the menu was in italian, which could be charming if done in the right way, but in this case it just made everyting impossible to decipher. I asked for italian dressing on my side-salad and was told that would be extra (I think around $6-8), to which I couldn't help but laugh out loud.  I told her to forget the salad and the server silently left the table, much to our relief, not unlike Lurch leaving the dining room of the Adam's family.  At this point I was tempted to follow the waitress and tell her to cancel our order, inform management that we were leaving and go to literally any other restaurant to eat.  But my wife was too embarrassed to do that so we stuck it out.   Approximately 15 minutes later Strangest Waitress Ever appeared with our food. My wife's $18 spaghetti was about 1/16 pound of cooked pasta drowning in a bowl of watery marinara that looked like it was dumped straight out of a tin can that had spent 10 years in a fallout shelter.  It was laughable.  The one lone positive of the evening was that my food was fairly tasty.  No where near worth $28 for such a small serving (maybe 10-12 tortellini), but it was good.  My wifes meal I wouldn't pay a penny for. She forced herself to consume half of it before she called it quits.  While we "dined", we got a kick out of the 20-something cook and waitress pairing that were flirting so heavily behind the glass windows fronting the wood-fired pizza oven and prep area, that we bet each other on how long it'd be before they hopped up on the counter and started going at it.  It would have been mortifying if not so entertaining.  I considered informing the manager of this display but he looked to be about 14 years old.  Also, forgot to add, no bread at the table.  A ~$60 meal and essentially we got a gross bottle of tea, half a serving of sausage tortellini and some gross spaghetti. I wouldn't send my worst enemy here

f09tRbcSfs6X9CZonHoNuQ.text: Dined at IL Pizzaiolo last night for the first time. The atmosphere was great, not overly crowded and the chairs are super comfy! I got the Parmigiana Melanzane per a recommendation from our server. I had high hopes but It was awful. Definitely over cooked, soggy, borderline slimy. The eggplant didn't seem fresh and for $22 I wish it had come with some type of pasta so at least I had something to eat.   My boyfriend had the wedding soup which was good, and the Ragu Napoletano with some spice added to it. His main dish was fantastic. The pasta was cooked well, the flavors of the meat and ragu were delicious. I wish I had followed suit and got what he had. We will definitely be back, but I do not recommend any of the Eggplant dishes.

acANsyT97TXWaxsEsqouUg.text: Meh. Over priced. Waaaaaaaaay over priced. 22 bucks for a 8 cut pizza is crazy. 19 bucks for spaghetti???? Wood fired b.s.  my weber grill makes a better pie.  The food is average at best. Prices are insane for pasta and pie. Kinda bummed as dining options are limited in the area.

Mr3PfzlLl-YSunTuEqNEQQ.text: Not new to the the Pizzaiolo experience, but to this location. Every visit is always a great experience. Last night, was probably my best experience in an Il Pizzaiolo. Resha was our waitress, and she not only represented the restaurant well, but made the night extremely special. Her among the other staff's poise and level of service was above and beyond the already stellar service they always give. What a great new addition to the Hampton Area. I know who I will request next time I make reservations.

3DeHVlV04vTsWrURR0_QvQ.text: Went back for those meatballs a couple of weeks ago.  They were great!  Our table didn't even get sprayed by the busboy.  It's nice not having to drive into the city to get some good Italian food.

wENCCsgqAJHk1qmtsf0DvQ.text: Absolutely awful service. The bartenders are completely inappropriate in their choice of discussions. The place is tidy but the food has gone down hill. Not many options in the area so it could do well but they really need to consider a new staff. They look miserable, unpleasant and act unprofessional.

q5oflrsULc1mmqiVtd69vg.text: Local Italian restaurant with plenty of seating and nice ambience.  The prices are high and the food is mediocre.  IMHO.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States. Sad looking pizza topping distribution, for the price, you expect better quality.

6rGoDNCtQG1IAf5BMpItjQ.text: A group of three of us ordered calamari, a pizza salsicce and a pasta (Paglia E Fieno) to share.  The calamari was thinly battered, crispy, and tender. Yet it was missing a component of flavor and seasoning. They also only served the "rings" and none of the mini tentacles. Pale and a bit disappointing.  The pizza had a delicious flavor and the crust is soft and airy. However, the crust holding the toppings are so thin that the sauce seeps through the thinnest part that the texture is off putting when you put it in your mouth.   The pasta probably was the best of the three. The presentation is very nice and the cream sauce is delicious.   I might come back to try another pasta dish or to try the clams that were sold out early in the evening.   Overall, a bit expensive ($54 + tax&tip) but the service is good and some of the dishes here might be worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States

5Cr-20esr8mjTQu9UWIJmQ.text: We dined here last Sunday evening and perhaps the kitchen was short-staffed, because the bar area sure was.  We had to ask for water refills and our Caesar salads ($8 each) took forever to arrive; we wished they had stayed in the kitchen-all yellow Romaine lettuce, with nary an anchovy in sight in any of the four salads.  As for the pasta, for $22 I expect my cavatelli rapini to be memorable. And not because it was so meh.  For a wonderful Italian dinner, in a lovelier space, drive a few more miles to Alta Via for their absolutely fabulous tortelli.  Il Pizzaiolo, Harts Run Road, seems to be skating by on the favorable reviews of it's other locations.

PSvc4oyDZXuH_YkOUGtrXg.text: Had a great dinner for my first visit here last night for a crew of five. We will return as have some already in our party. Food and service were great and they sent us home with leftovers in compostable paper boxes -- great job!  (Although they were in plastic bags which we didn't think to decline -- boo on us). Will try to remember next time and also decline the straws.

6pPueW-52zDrO15DRMtfdw.text: Although on the pricey side, the food and atmosphere were fantastic. My husband and I split the Montanara pizza and Gnocchi. We got the zucchini as our appetizer and enjoyed all of the food. The service was great, we sat in the bar area which looked onto the patio with a fireplace. We will definitely be back to enjoy the patio and food in the warmer weather!

DDeGbCagEX4PzvsUTSQCFg.text: Everything there is overpriced, basically twice what it should cost.  $18 for a calzone with no side, or anything else?  It should be $9.    $28 for Linguine?  I'm not sure how they justify these prices.  We came with 8 people, and they put us at a 6 seat table.  Instead of moving another table over, they just put cramped us into the 6 seat table.  They don't refill your water glass, they just put a bottle of water on the table, and when that's all used up, guess what?  They don't bring over more water.  Look, if you're going to charge this much for food, and include the gratuity, the bare minimum you can do is give us water.  The windows should be tinted, they're way to bright making it hard to see the people across the table in contrast to the bright light behind them.  And the handicap parking space is not next to the front door.  Why even bother having a handicap parking space if you're going to put regular parking closer to the door than handicap parking?  I ordered a calzone from the pizza section of the menu and they didn't bring me a pizza, they brought me a calzone.  I'm not sure why they put a calzone in the pizza section if it's not a pizza.  Okay, now for some positives.  There's nothing wrong with the food it's self, it tasted like average pizza, salad, and calzone.  Everything was clean, the tables and chairs, and everything was clearly built of high quality materials.  And even though the wait staff didn't refill out water, there was no problems other than that, they were friendly.  And it was someone's birthday and they gave them a desert for free.  Really my main complaint is the price.  That $22 Stracciatella pizza, and that $22 Salumiera Pizza.  No those are not a family size pizza, they are not 16 or 18 inches.  Nope they are 10 inch pizza for $22 plus tax and tip.  If you get a drink, you could easily end up paying $60 for 2 people to have a lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States

NODH1OwVbbAiPpRS9BhTWg.text: The food and atmosphere are fantastic. We've been to Il Pizzaiolo multiple times and will continue coming back.   Yes, the prices are more expensive than local alternatives, but the quality is also better. The pasta is always cooked perfectly al dente. We've loved every dish we've gotten here. And the service has always been good.

96mHTAua7noxbMWD_qdJAw.text: I'm giving this place two stars because the food was excellent. I can't say the same thing about the service. Most employees didn't seem happy. I know everyone has a cell phone and it showed with this staff. We felt like an inconvenience. I probably would have mentioned it to a manager except I never saw someone who looked like a manager. The decorations were very nice but the ladies room was such a mess. The patio and bar looked inviting, however, we sat in the dining room because we missed happy hour. I was hoping to love this place because of its location.

qUHU3TC2RuLwUUOgpDxiTA.text: Very nice atmosphere, but the food left a lot to be desired. The fried calamari seemed like it was prepackaged, not a lot of flavor whatsoever. Had the cavatelli rapini with sweet fennel sausage, but the sausage was so spicy hot and salty that I had to pick it all out for the pasta to be edible.  Service matched to quality of food, just so-so  Menu prices reflect that of a higher-end eatery, but for what you get, it is very overpriced.

MEyDgDzccV4U8AYWClXWWQ.text: I would give this a 4 star review strictly for food, and only 2 stars for the price of everything. The zucchini planks were good, not too fried and a little different. The selection of pizza wasn't the greatest. All of the pizzas seemed to be very similar. My husband got the diavolo and I got the fughi- both good but not worth 20 dollars for each pizza. The service was okay, not the best either. I think there are a ton of other artisan pizza places in Pittsburgh to explore that aren't this expensive, have more selection, and if I'm paying 20 dollars for a small pizza the service should be phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States. Fughi pizza
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States. Diavolo pizza
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States. Fried Zucchini

jFCtrVY4iRMu7rlX5Mw4nA.text: This has got to be one of the most poorly managed restaurants I have visited. The gentleman who works behind the bar is the only good employee visible. Attentive to his guest and knowledgeable. The female manger there on the evening of Wednesday June 19th is probably one of the most miserable people I have ever encountered. The food was just ok. Probably won't be back.

9Vhv8h7dBt8iSzgq9PgQ4A.text: I think this place deserves more than the 3 stars it has right now.   It serves the same food as the other two locations, including its first in Mt. Lebanon, and it's second in Warrendale (which was highly upscaled from the first) -- but in an even nicer atmosphere than the previous two. There's a beautiful patio outside, and the inside is also wonderfully decorated (past the bar; the bar is maybe the most mundane room, but still ok).  Yes, the pizza is expensive comparative to Domino's or Pizza Hut, etc., but they're serving their best attempt at authentic Italian pizza; they're not trying to feed a family of four with take-out on a budget.   I don't even recommend you do take-out, because this restaurant is about authenticity and atmosphere, along with great taste, not being economical. It's for a special treat, not for a hum-drum Friday night.  As long as you go understanding this, I think you'll be satisfied and eager to return.

0jPaZjffe97zpqfIV9vXeg.text: Warm, professional service from Vincenza and staff, amazing food and beverages, with  wonderful live jazz piano from David Gurwin - on a Thursday evening! - --.was the cherry on the sundae, or in our case the olive in the martini. Definite recommendation and we plan to return soon.  Joyce and Denny

uf29lIhtRJ7gae57lsHPIA.text: We had a fabulous meal here. There was a very nice wine selection. We ordered 2 appetizers, 3 different pizzas and two pasta dishes to share family style, and everything was fantastic.  The pasta was True al dente (not overcooked), with good flavored sauces.  The pizza was an excellent neapolitan style crust (thin and light) with original and traditional toppings. Don't come here if you're looking for Pizza Hut pizza, this is real Italian style pizza. It's a bit pricey, but I would eat here again for the ambiance. Thank you for a lovely evening!

P9qiwc74yzy5SCvWqSOlDw.text: This place has a very nice decor and looks very elegant when you walk in. Our server seemed like she was just going through the motions and was not very engaging or friendly. It was a Saturday and they were busy so that may have had something to do with it. For what I and my companions paid for our meals, I thought the food was good but average and not worth the price.

NPRRqxRQhs54r9w3ZbWeOw.text: I have been here a couple of times and honestly I will not go back.  I got take out for me and my wife and we got an order of the tagliatelle bolognese, a margherita pizza, a piece of tiramisu, and delizia al limone.  The food was ok but the portion sizes were tiny.  I'm not one to complain about prices of food but I got a container of pasta that was smaller than a greeting card.  And to be honest the quality was no better than other Italian restaurant in the area. I would not recommend and definitely don't think it's worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Glenshaw, PA, United States

Sw1Q1OEgVOtz4MJKVDEcsA.text: A fine, fine Italian restaurant . I have been a regular at the original Mt Lebanon location and also Market Square.  Cheeses ( including Buffalo Mozzarella and Pecorino Romano) shipped weekly from Italy.  Salads- only the freshest  Pizza- have to go to New York or Italy to compare... Wedding soup will ruin you for any other in Pittsburgh.  Wonderful pastas! All Italian wines.

g_BJ2jhUf52dAZNKiLXmjA.text: My wife loves the calzone. Very quality ingredients. Good espresso drinks, tasty desserts. Don't whine about the prices.
